intro: Paraboea glabrisepala, commonly known as the smooth-sepal paraboea, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
